Name: BELLPEPPER
Description:
RED
 pa80
Easy-growing variety, fruit 8 cm wide and 5 cm tall, some visual similarity to beefsteak tomatoes. Flesh thick and aromatic. Colour turns from dark-green to bright red during ripening.
Fruit type: flat-round

Explanations: null
Name: CHILI
Description:
MIXTURE
pa50
Blend of a large variety of colours and shapes. The colours of the fruits vary from intense yellow to orange, brown, and bright red. Medium heat. Chili Mix is well suited for cultivation outdoors.
Fruit type: mostly pointed

Explanations:
ProSpecieRara: This variety has been awarded by ProSpecieRara as a rare or old variety. ProSpecieRara is a foundation dedicated to preserving the diversity of rare plant varieties. In long-term cooperation with ProSpecieRara, Sativa is active in the important preservation and cultivation of these traditional varieties.
Conservation Breeding: For this variety Sativa practices conservation breeding in Rheinau. To ensure high-quality varieties, they must be maintained. They are regularly replicated and selected by their positive characteristics. In doing so the varieties are continually improved and adapted to growing conditions.

Description:

 pa64

Name: CORNO
Description:
DI BUE ROSSO
 pa63

Explanations: Bioverita: This variety is an organic, newly bred, variety. It has been cultivated from the very outset in organic conditions, to best adapt to organic cultivation. Varieties that carry the Bioverita label are reproducible and fertile, and aim to offer an alternative to hybrid-seeds to professional gardeners.
Name: CUBO
Description:
ORANGE RS
 pa29
Heavy, thick-skinned, broad and chunky professional variety from Reinsaat in Austria. Color changes from dark green to deep orange. Good and very fruity flavor. Fruit weight: 250 g.
Fruit type: elongated, blocky

Name: DE
Description:
CAYENNE
pa43

Explanations: null
Name: JALAPENO
Description:
'RUBEN' RS
pa44
One of the most popular chili plants. Fruit 7 cm long, juicy and thick skinned. Pungent, but pleasant heat. The unripe green fruit is often picked. After picking they will turn a little sweeter.
Fruit type: pointed, tip blunted

Description:
pa25

Name: LADY
Description:
LOU KS
 pa70

Fruit type: pointed, slightly larger

Name: LEMON
Description:
DROP
 pa45
These citrusy hot chillies are thin-walled, have hardly any seeds and ripen from green to pale yellow. They are moderately hot and can be used fresh in salads. Large, well-branching, high-yielding chilli variety.
Fruit type: Pointed, slender

Name: LILA
Description:
LUZI
pa40

Name: POSITANO
Description:
RS
pa46
Inflorescences grow in upright clusters and mature from green to red. The fruits are 6-8 cm long and about 2 cm wide. Can be conveniently harvested in bunches and will continue to ripen. Also suitable for chili powder. Medium hot.
